body_html:
I met the same problem. But you should notice that when you install tensorflow it use snumpy version A and when you run app of tensorflow you use numpy version 7. Just does not match.
You can check your running numpy version by: pip freeze or import numpy and numpy.version.version to verify this. The solution is to update your numpy to the tensorflow installing dependent numpy version.
body_text:
I met the same problem. But you should notice that when you install tensorflow  it use snumpy version A and when you run app of tensorflow you use numpy version 7. Just does not match.
You can check your running numpy version by: pip freeze or import numpy and numpy.version.version to verify this. The solution is to update your numpy to the tensorflow installing dependent numpy version.
body:
I met the same problem. But you should notice that when you install tensorflow  it use snumpy version A and when you run app of tensorflow you use numpy version 7. Just does not match. 
You can check your running numpy version by: `pip freeze` or `import numpy` and `numpy.version.version` to verify this. The solution is to update your numpy to the tensorflow installing dependent numpy version.
